oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Charlie Worsham - 2018-06-09
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by and interview with Charlie Worsham from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on June 9, 2018. Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Charlie Worsham; Abi Tapia;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in Music / (05:58) Opening comments and introductions by Abi Tapia / (08:55) Opening comments by Charlie / (09:08) Performs Young To See / (12:18) Introduces the next song / (12:41) Performs Old Time's Sake / (15:48) Introduces the next song / (16:21) Performs Don't Quit Your Daydream / (20:00) Talks about performing at the Outlaws exhibit opening concert / (20:59) Abi asks Charlie about why he decided to write a book / (22:49) Charlie reads an excerpt of his book about Marty Stuart / (27:31) Charlie talks about when and why he started writing songs / (29:59) Charlie talks about his tell the truth notebooks / (31:54) Charlie talks about how writing his book has affected his songwriting / (33:00) Charlie talks about Mississippi and it's influence on him and his music / (35:!9) Charlie talks about what makes him feel at home during his travels / (37:03) Talks about his commitment to young people's education and the arts and his Follow Your Heart arts program / (40:11) Talk about his current focus and plans for the future / (44:06) Introduces the next song / (45:05) Performs You Make Me Believe In Love / (48:56) Introduces the next song / (49:14) Performs Cut Your Groove / (53:01) Introduces the next song / (56:11) Performs In It For The Love / (59:49) Closing comments / (01:00:10) Walk-out Music / (01:00:34) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:format: original source recorded as an mp3 file at 44.1
